Requirements: An undergraduate B.S. degree in physics, engineering or a related discipline, with a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0. Three letters of recommendation. Graduate Record Examination (GRE) General Test is required. For international applicants, the Test of English as aForeign Language (TOEFL) is required. The application also includes a statement of purpose.

Stony Brook University Graduate School online application
Application fee
One unofficial transcript from each university/college attended
GMAT or GRE score reports* (optional)
*GMAT/GRE scores are currently optional through the Fall 2025 semester.
Personal statement/essay
Resume or CV
Two letters of recommendation
TOEFL/IELTS score (for international students)
An interview may be required

Admission is based on a holistic review of each applicant’s credentials, including prior academic performance, GMAT or GRE score, letters of recommendation, statement of purpose, and resume. Evidence of strong quantitative skills is important for admission. Prior work experience is valued, but not required.

A bachelor's degree with a B or better cumulative grade point average. Official transcripts from all colleges and universities attended. A current resume. A personal statement/essay describing your reasons for pursuing the MBA degree and your short- and long-term career goals. Two letters of recommendation. It is strongly suggested that at least one letter be from a college professor. GMAT or GRE test score. (GMAT/GRE waivers are available for some highly qualified candidates.) International applicants who did not receive their primary undergraduate degree from a US institution will also need to submit one of the following: TOEFL, IELTS, or Duolingo English Test. An interview with an admissions representative.

An undergraduate degree from an accredited U.S. institution or the international equivalent. Undergraduate degree in accounting not required. A minimum undergraduate GPA of 3.2 is normally required for admission. Exceptional cases may be considered on an individual basis. A current resume. A statement of purpose. Two letters of recommendation, submitted online. The GMAT is not required but scores may be submitted to strengthen a candidate’s application. If you elect to submit scores, there is no minimum required score. International students are required to take the TOEFL or IELTS exam unless they have received a degree from an institution in which the primary language of instruction is English. Minimum TOEFL score is 85; minimum IELTS score is 6.5 with no subsection below 6. Prerequisites must be completed with a grade of C or higher.

To be eligible to apply, students must: Be a current Stony Brook undergraduate student. Have a Stony Brook cumulative GPA of 3.2 or higher. Be on track to complete all of the requirements for your bachelor's degree by the time you start your first MBA class. Meet with an MBA advisor and an undergraduate advisor to ensure that you are on track to complete both degrees on time. Please complete our form to arrange an appointment. You must do this before you apply.

To apply to the MBA and MS programs in the College of Business, you will need the following: Online application and application fee; Official transcripts from all colleges and universities attended (an unofficial copy can be uploaded for application review, but official transcripts are required upon admission); A current resume or curriculum vitae, detailing professional experience, including titles, dates, and responsibilities; An essay detailing your reasons for pursuing a graduate degree and your academic and professional goals; Three letters of recommendation. The GMAT/GRE requirement is currently being waived for all applicants to the MBA programs. International students may need to provide TOEFL or IELTS scores.

Applicants must be current Stony Brook University undergraduate students in good academic standing. GPA of 3.0 or better. Completed all SBU D.E.C. and major requirements to be eligible for graduation. Completed the following prerequisite courses with a grade of B or better: One semester of college-level mathematics (calculus preferred); One semester of social and behavioral sciences. Application Materials: An application to the Graduate School, A current résumé, A statement of purpose, Official transcripts from all colleges and universities attended, Three letters of recommendation. GRE test scores are not required for admission.

Master of Science degree in nursing with a major in one of the following advanced practice areas: nurse practitioner (adult, family, adult-gerontology primary care), clinical nurse specialist (adult health), or certified registered nurse anesthetist. For consideration for admission, applicants must have graduated from a program accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education (CCNE) or the Accreditation Commission for Education in Nursing (ACEN).
Licensure as a Registered Nurse and Nurse Practitioner in New York State.
National certification as a nurse practitioner.
A minimum of one-year of full-time work experience (two years preferred) as a nurse practitioner in a hospital setting with the critically ill population.
Current ACLS certification.
Three letters of recommendation.
A personal statement.
A current resume.
Successful completion of an admission interview.
An undergraduate or graduate statistics course with a grade of C or better.
A cumulative GPA of 3.0.
All applicants to the School of Nursing are required to submit their application and supporting documents via NursingCAS (www.nursingcas.org).
Program name: Adult-Gerontology Acute Care Nurse Practitioner Certificate

Requirements: Unofficial transcripts from all colleges and universities attended. A bachelor's degree in nursing (BSN) from a program accredited by a national nursing accrediting agency. Minimum cumulative grade point average of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. Current, unencumbered NYS RN license and registration. At least one year of recent acute care experience as a registered nurse. Current BLS certification. Three letters of recommendation. Personal Statement. Resume/CV. Official transcripts will be required if you are offered admission. Proof of English Proficiency for international students whose native language is not English.
Program name: Adult-Gerontology Acute Care Nurse Practitioner MSN

Requirements:
Admission to the Adult-Gerontology Primary Care Nurse Practitioner program is based on the following:
1. Master of science degree in nursing from a program accredited by a national accreditation agency approved by the State Education Department (e.g., CCNE, ACEN).
2. Minimum cumulative grade point average of 3.0.
3. Current, unencumbered New York State license and registration as a Registered Professional Nurse.
4. National certification in a nurse practitioner specialty.
5. Completion of a graduate-level course in each of the following: advanced pathophysiology, advanced pharmacology and advanced physical assessment within the last five years.*
6. Personal interview with faculty.
7. One year of clinical experience as a nurse practitioner is preferred.
Program name: Adult-Gerontology Primary Care Nurse Practitioner Certificate

Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in nursing (BS) from a nationally accredited program.
Cumulative grade point average of 3.0.
Undergraduate statistics course with a grade of C or better.
Undergraduate research course with a grade of C or better.
Unencumbered license to practice as a registered professional nurse in New York State.
A minimum of one-year full-time clinical experience as a registered nurse in a medical-surgical setting is required for Adult-Gerontology Primary Care NP, and Psychiatric Mental Health NP programs.
A curriculum vitae (CV) or résumé.
Three letters of recommendation. See specific instructions regarding recommendations on the application.
A personal statement describing the applicant's reasons for pursuing graduate study, professional goals, and why they want to attend Stony Brook University.
Non-native English speakers must take and submit TOEFL or IELTS scores.
Program name: Adult-Gerontology Primary Care Nurse Practitioner MSN

Requirements: All applicants must be graduates of a CODA-accredited dental school and must have successfully completed National Board Dental Examination, Part I and Part II (Part I is required at the time of application; Part II is required before entering the program). Applicants must apply through the Postdoctoral Application Support Service (PASS) of the American Dental Education Association (ADEA). All application materials must be submitted through PASS. Please do not send any application materials directly to the program. Applicants must be registered with the Postdoctoral Dental Matching Program. A personal interview is required for admission.
Program name: Advanced Dental Education Program General Practice Residency

Requirements: The program participates in the Postdoctoral Application Support Service (PASS) and Postdoctoral Dental Matching Program (the “MATCH”). Requirements for Application: Completed PASS Application; Personal Statement; Curriculum Vitae (CV); Official Dental School Transcripts; Official Undergraduate Transcripts; INBDE Score Report; ADAT Score Report (optional); Three Letters of Recommendation; 2x2 Photograph; Non-refundable application fee submitted directly to the program.
Program name: Advanced Dental Education Program in Dental Anesthesiology

Requirements: Applicants must be a U.S. Citizen or permanent resident of the U.S. and have a DDS/DMD from a CODA accredited dental school. A passing score on the National Board Dental Examination (NBDE) is required. The application requires a 2x2 photo, CV, undergraduate transcripts, NBDE Part I and II scores, and ADAT Score to be uploaded. Three Professional Evaluation Forms (PEFs) are also required.
Program name: Advanced Dental Education Program in Endodontics

Requirements:
1. D.D.S., D.M.D. or equivalent degree.
2. Successful completion of Parts I and II of the National Dental Board Examination (for graduates of ADA-accredited schools).
3. Proficiency in the English language. Applicants whose native language is not English must take the TOEFL examination. A minimum score of 550 (paper based), 213 (computer based) or 85 (Internet based) is required for admission.
4. Participation in the Postdoctoral Dental Matching Program (MATCH) and the Postdoctoral Application Support Service (PASS). All application materials must be submitted through PASS. For information and an application, contact PASS directly.
5. Three letters of recommendation.
6. Personal interview.
Program name: Advanced Dental Education Program in Oral and Maxillofacial Radiology

Requirements: Applicants apply through the Postdoctoral Application Support Service (PASS) of the American Dental Education Association (ADEA). All application materials, including the following, must be submitted through PASS: Official transcripts from all undergraduate and dental schools attended; National Board Scores (Part I and Part II when available); And three letters of recommendation (one must be from the dean of the applicant's dental school).
Program name: Advanced Dental Education Program in Orthodontics and Dentofacial Orthopedics

Requirements: Applications for the Stony Brook University Advanced Education Program in Pediatric Dentistry are accepted through the American Dental Education Association Postdoctoral Application Support Service (ADEA PASS). A complete PASS application includes: Personal Statement, Curriculum Vitae (CV), 2"x2" photo, Official dental school transcripts, Official undergraduate transcripts, Official National Board Dental Examination Scores, Parts I and II, Three letters of recommendation (one must be from the Dean of your dental school), Advanced Dental Admission Test (ADAT) scores are required. For foreign-trained applicants, TOEFL is required.
Program name: Advanced Dental Education Program in Pediatric Dentistry

Requirements: Applicants must have graduated from a CODA-accredited dental school. Required tests include the Dental Admission Test (DAT) and the National Board Dental Examination (NBDE), which must be passed prior to matriculation. The Advanced Dental Admission Test (ADAT) is accepted but not required. Applicants from non-CODA accredited dental schools must submit official TOEFL scores, with a minimum of 550 for the paper-based test and 90 for the internet-based test. Required documents include three letters of recommendation (one from the Dean of the dental school), a Curriculum Vitae/Resume, a Personal Statement, official transcripts from all undergraduate and dental schools attended, and a 2”x 2” photograph. A supplemental application fee of $100 must be sent directly to the program.
Program name: Advanced Dental Education Program in Periodontics

Requirements: Applicants for the Advanced Education Program in Prosthodontics (certificate only) must apply through the American Dental Education Association's Postdoctoral Application Support Service (PASS) and participate in the Postdoctoral Dental Matching Program (the "Match"). In addition to the requirements of the Graduate School, the following are required for admission into the certificate program: A D.D.S. or D.M.D. degree from a CODA-accredited dental school, or the equivalent. Successful completion of Part I and Part II of the National Dental Board Examination. Applicants for whom English is not their native language must take the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL). The Educational Testing Service code for the Graduate School is 2548. A minimum score of 550 (written), 213 (computer-based), or 85 (internet-based) is required for admission. A personal interview is required. Three letters of recommendation. At least two of the letters should be from prosthodontists. One of the letters should be from the Dean of the applicant's dental school. All advanced education students must have a New York State restricted residency permit or a New York State dental license prior to enrollment.
Program name: Advanced Dental Education Program in Prosthodontics

Requirements: All applicants must be current Stony Brook graduate students or have a minimum of a Bachelor's degree from an accredited institution. Applicants must submit an application through the Stony Brook Graduate School, which includes a personal statement, transcripts from all undergraduate and graduate institutions, and three letters of recommendation. GRE scores are not required.
Program name: Advanced Graduate Certificate in data and computational science

Requirements:
To apply for the MA in Mass Communication, you will need to submit the following materials through the Graduate School's online application system:

A completed application form and fee.
Transcripts from all undergraduate and graduate institutions attended.
Three letters of recommendation from faculty or professionals who can speak to your academic and professional potential.
A 1-2 page statement of purpose outlining your reasons for pursuing a graduate degree in mass communication, your career goals, and your specific interests in our program.
A writing sample, such as a research paper, a professional report, or a portfolio of creative work.
A resume outlining your relevant experience.
GRE scores are optional for all applicants.
For international students, TOEFL or IELTS scores are required unless you have a degree from an institution in an English-speaking country. Please see the Graduate School's website for more information on English proficiency requirements.

The Certificate in Africana Studies is open to any graduate student in good standing in a Master’s or Doctoral degree-granting program at Stony Brook. Students interested in pursuing the Certificate should consult with the Director of the Department or a designated member of the Graduate Committee. Students may apply for the Certificate program after they have been admitted to a graduate degree-granting program at Stony Brook. Students must complete a Certificate application form to be signed by their Graduate Program Director and the Director of the Africana Studies Department. Applicants for the Certificate program should submit an application to the Director of the Department.

To be considered for admission to the MA program in Africana Studies, an applicant must: Have earned a BA degree from an accredited institution with a major in Africana Studies or related field in the Humanities or Social Sciences; Have earned a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0; Submit a completed application to the Graduate School, including: Statement of purpose; Three letters of recommendation; A writing sample; Transcripts from all undergraduate and graduate institutions attended; An application fee. The GRE is not required for admission.

Applicants must have earned a Master’s degree in a health or human services related field, from an accredited institution. Applicants must complete the Stony Brook University Graduate School online application, which includes: Official transcripts from all colleges and universities attended. Resume. Personal statement. Three letters of recommendation. TOEFL scores for international applicants. Application Fee. All applications are reviewed by the HA Program Admissions Committee. Applications are accepted for Fall admissions only.
Program name: Aging Populations and Healthcare Administration, Advanced Certificate

Requirements:
Candidates for admission must have a baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university. An undergraduate major in one of the biological sciences is recommended. Students whose undergraduate major is in another area may be considered for admission, but may be required to correct deficiencies in their background by taking appropriate undergraduate courses without graduate credit. A strong background in the physical sciences also is recommended.

Specific course prerequisites are one year of general biology, one year of general chemistry, and one year of organic chemistry. One year of physics is desirable. The average undergraduate GPA should be a minimum of 3.0.

The applicant must submit a personal statement, three letters of recommendation from faculty members who are familiar with the applicant’s academic abilities, and a current curriculum vitae. Test scores from the GRE or MCAT are not required, but are highly recommended. A TOEFL or IELTS score is required for all applicants from countries in which English is not the official language.

Applicants should have a B.S. or B.A. degree in one of the biological or chemical sciences and should have a minimum GPA of 3.0. Required undergraduate courses include one year of biology, general chemistry, organic chemistry, and physics. A course in biochemistry is strongly recommended. In addition to transcripts, a personal statement of career goals, and three letters of recommendation, GRE scores (verbal, quantitative, and analytical writing) are required. Students whose native language is not English are required to take the TOEFL exam (minimum acceptable score is 550 for the paper-based test or 80 for the iBT). Applications are reviewed by the Anatomical Sciences Graduate Program Admissions Committee. Applications must be received by January 15.

Applicants for admission to the doctoral program in Anthropological Sciences must have a bachelor’s degree from an accredited university. We admit students who intend to pursue a doctorate in one of two major subfields of anthropology: either Archaeology or Evolutionary Anthropology. Students accepted into the doctoral program will normally have had some undergraduate training in anthropology, and should have a good background in a related field such as biology, geology, psychology or anatomy. Applicants with a master’s degree in anthropology or a related field are also welcome to apply. All applicants must submit a completed application form, 3 letters of recommendation, a statement of purpose, transcripts of all college-level work, a résumé or C.V., and a writing sample. The GRE requirement is suspended for this program at this time.

Stony Brook Graduate School online application; application fee; transcripts and one official copy of all undergraduate and graduate transcripts; three letters of recommendation; GRE General Test (school code: 2548). Test scores are not required for students applying to enroll in Fall 2024; statement of purpose; curriculum vitae; writing sample; and TOEFL or IELTS is required for applicants whose native language is not English.

Required Application Materials include the Graduate School Application and application fee, transcripts from all previous institutions attended, three letters of recommendation, and a personal statement. The GRE General Test is no longer required for admission to the MA program. For international students, TOEFL/IELTS scores are required.
Program name: Concentration in Applied Biological Anthropology (Anthropology MA)

Requirements: A bachelor’s degree in geology or a closely-related field, with a GPA > 3.0. Preference will be given to students with an MS degree in geology or a closely related field or to those with work experience in the petroleum industry.

1. A bachelor's degree in any field, with a cumulative grade point average of 3.0 or higher.
2. One year of college-level mathematics or statistics with a grade of C or better.
3. Three letters of recommendation.
4. Personal Statement.
5. For international students, TOEFL or IELTS is required. Please see http://grad.stonybrook.edu/admissions/international/english_proficiency.php.
6. GRE is required, MCATs or GMATs will be accepted in lieu of GREs. The GRE requirement can be waived based on prior education and experience. Please contact the program director for more information.
A completed on-line application that includes all of the above must be received by the program's stated application deadline.

A master's degree from an accredited institution. Applicants may be enrolled in a master's degree program at the time of their application, but their degree must be conferred before starting the doctoral program.
A minimum of a 3.0 cumulative grade point average (GPA) on a 4.0 scale in all graduate coursework.
Three or more years of professional experience in education and/or a learning-related field.
GRE scores are not required.

In addition to the Graduate School’s general admission requirements, applicants are expected to have a strong background in undergraduate mathematics, including courses in multivariate calculus, linear algebra and differential equations. Some familiarity with computers is expected and a course in probability and statistics is desirable. A minimum undergraduate grade point average of 3.00 on a 4.00 scale is required for admission. All applicants must submit a Graduate School application, including a personal statement, letters of recommendation, and transcripts of all previous college work.

In addition to the general admission requirements of the Graduate School, the following are required for admission to the Ph.D. program in Applied Mathematics and Statistics:
1. A bachelor’s degree in mathematics, a quantitative science, or an engineering discipline from an accredited college or university. The undergraduate program must have included at least three semesters of calculus (through multivariable integration), a course in linear algebra, and a course in differential equations. At least one calculus-based probability and statistics course is desirable, but not required.
2. A minimum cumulative grade point average of 3.0.
3. The Graduate Record Examination (GRE) General Test is not required, but applicants may submit scores if they have taken the test.
4. Three letters of recommendation.
5. International students are required to take the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL). A minimum score of 85 on the iBT is required for admission. See the Graduate School's requirements for more information.

Prerequisites: Bachelor's degree from an accredited university. One year of undergraduate Anatomy & Physiology with laboratory. Minimum undergraduate GPA of 3.0. Application Requirements: An online application to the Graduate School, including the application fee. A Personal Statement detailing your interest in the field of Applied Physiology. Three letters of recommendation from individuals familiar with your academic background and potential for success in graduate school. Official transcripts from each college or university attended. GRE scores are no longer required. A non-refundable application fee. International Applicants: English Proficiency: Please refer to the Graduate School requirements.

In addition to the Graduate School’s general requirements, applicants must possess: Minimum undergraduate GPA of 3.0. At least one semester of college level physics, college level chemistry, and calculus. Transcripts of all previous college and university work (Undergraduate & Graduate). A personal statement clearly stating career goals and reasons for interest in the program. Three letters of recommendation. Graduate Record Examination (GRE) scores are not required. For International Students, a TOEFL or IELTS score is required. A Resume or C.V. Completed online application. Application Fee.

The required materials are: Online application; Official transcripts from all undergraduate and graduate institutions attended; Three letters of recommendation; A statement of purpose describing your interest in the program and career goals; A current curriculum vitae (CV)/résumé; The application fee. The Graduate Record Examination (GRE) is not required for application to this program.

Applicants for admission to the M.S. and Ph.D. programs in Civil Engineering are expected to have a bachelor’s degree in civil engineering or a closely related field from a college or university of recognized standing. Applicants are judged on the basis of their previous academic performance (GPA), research or professional experience, three letters of recommendation, and a statement of purpose.

A complete application includes: The Common Application or ApplySUNY application, a $50 non-refundable application fee, your official high school transcript, a letter of recommendation from a teacher or counselor, SAT or ACT scores (Stony Brook is test-optional for the Spring 2025 and Fall 2025 semesters), and a required essay.

A bachelor's degree with a major in Art, Architecture, or Engineering, or the equivalent, or permission of the Program Director. Three letters of recommendation. A Statement of Purpose explaining the student’s motivation for entering the program. A portfolio. Resume or C.V. Transcripts from all previous colleges and universities attended. A minimum undergraduate grade point average of 3.0. For international students, a score of at least 550 (paper based) or 80 (internet based) on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL). All applications must be submitted online.

Applicants to the M.A. program must hold a Bachelor of Arts degree with a major in art history or a related discipline, with a minimum of 18 credits of upper-division coursework in art history or the equivalent. Successful applicants usually have a G.P.A. of 3.0 or higher. Applicants who do not satisfy these requirements may be admitted on a provisional basis, but will be required to make up any deficiencies by taking appropriate undergraduate courses. These courses must be taken for a letter grade and a grade of B or better must be obtained in each.

All applicants must submit the following materials electronically through the Slate application portal by the application deadline of January 7.
- Unofficial transcripts of all previous college and university study
- Three letters of recommendation
- A statement of purpose: a one- to two-page statement outlining your scholarly interests and academic and professional objectives. Indicate why you are specifically interested in pursuing your graduate studies at Stony Brook. Please list faculty whose research interests are close to your own.
- A curriculum vitae (CV)
- A writing sample: an academic paper of 15-20 pages on a subject in the history or theory of art, architecture, or visual culture. The paper should demonstrate your abilities in research, analysis, and argumentation.
- Official GRE General Test scores are optional for applicants to the MA and PhD programs.
- The TOEFL or IELTS is required for international students from countries in which English is not the official language. Consult the Graduate School’s website for more information on the English proficiency requirement.
- The non-refundable application fee is $100.

Application Requirements:
Statement of Purpose: Required
Letters of Recommendation (3): Required
Portfolio: Required (see Departmental website for details)
Graduate Record Examination (GRE): The GRE general test is NOT required.
Transcripts: Required
For details on the application process and requirements, please see the Departmental website and the Graduate School's admissions web pages.

Application to the Graduate School, Official transcripts from all universities and colleges attended, A personal statement, Three letters of recommendation, Resume or curriculum vitae, A portfolio. The GRE is not required for admission to this program.

Bachelor's degree with a 3.0 undergraduate GPA. One official transcript from each college/university attended. One letter of recommendation. A personal statement that addresses the following questions: 1) What has drawn you to pursue a career in arts leadership?; 2) What are your long-term career goals?; and 3) What special attributes or qualities do you have that would make you a good candidate for this program? A résumé that documents a minimum of 3 years of work experience in the arts and culture sector. A non-refundable $100 application fee.

Applicants to this program should have a bachelor's degree in any field. In addition to the SPD application requirements, applicants are required to submit a statement of purpose. General SPD application requirements include: an online application and application fee, transcripts, a statement of purpose, two letters of recommendation, and a résumé.

To be considered for admission, applicants must have:

- A bachelor’s degree
- A minimum cumulative grade point average of 3.0
- Submitted a complete application for matriculation, which includes:
    - Online application.
    - Application fee.
    - A current resume.
    - One- to two-page (500 words maximum) career goals essay (i.e. statement of purpose) describing your interest in the program and any pertinent professional and/or academic experience.
    - One letter of recommendation.
    - Official transcripts from all colleges and universities attended.
    - International students must also submit TOEFL/IELTS scores.

Application to the MS in Athletic Training degree program is through the Athletic Training Centralized Application System (ATCAS). The following are required for admission:

*   A baccalaureate degree from an accredited institution.
*   An overall grade point average (GPA) of 3.0 or higher.
*   Completion of prerequisite coursework with a C or better (see below for specific courses).
*   50 hours of observation with a Certified Athletic Trainer (ATC).
*   Three letters of recommendation, one from an ATC or physical therapist. One academic reference is required. The third can be a professional or academic reference.
*   Official transcripts from all universities/colleges attended must be submitted to ATCAS.
*   A personal statement.
*   A curriculum vitae (CV) or resume.
*   Official Graduate Record Examination (GRE) Scores.

Due to COVID-19 and potential difficulty in scheduling a GRE exam, the GRE will be waived for the 2020-2021 admissions cycle. Applicants are not required to take the exam for this cycle.

For applicants whose native or primary language is not English, a minimum TOEFL score of 85 (iBT) is required.

Applicants must meet the requirements for admission to the Graduate School. In addition to these requirements, applicants must also meet the specific program requirements: Completed bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution prior to the start of the program. Overall GPA of 3.0 or better. GPA of 3.0 or better in the required prerequisite coursework. 50 documented hours of observation of an Athletic Trainer (must be a Certified Athletic Trainer). These hours must be completed under the supervision of more than one Athletic Trainer, preferably in a variety of athletic training settings. Completion of the following prerequisite courses: Biology with lab (4 credits), Chemistry with lab (4 credits), Physics with lab (4 credits), Human Anatomy & Physiology I with lab (4 credits), Human Anatomy & Physiology II with lab (4 credits), Exercise Physiology with lab (4 credits), Biomechanics or Kinesiology (3 credits), Nutrition (3 credits), Psychology (3 credits), Statistics (3 credits). Two letters of recommendation, one must be from a Certified Athletic Trainer. Personal statement. Interview with AT Program Faculty. All students must comply with the AT Program technical standards.

Applicants are required to have a Bachelor of Science degree in meteorology, atmospheric sciences, or a related field (e.g., physics, mathematics, engineering, or chemistry). Undergraduate course work should include mathematics through differential equations and at least one year of calculus-based physics. Three letters of recommendation. A minimum undergraduate GPA of 3.0. The Graduate Record Examination (GRE) is NOT required.

To be considered for admission into the doctoral program in atmospheric sciences, applicants must have a bachelor’s degree in atmospheric sciences, meteorology, physics, chemistry, engineering, computer science, mathematics, or a related field. Students are not required to have a master’s degree before applying for admission to the PhD program.

All applicants must submit:
1. An online application to the Graduate School.
2. Official transcripts of all undergraduate and graduate work.
3. Three letters of recommendation.
4. A personal statement describing research interests and career goals.
5. Graduate Record Examination (GRE) scores are optional for applicants.
6. Applicants whose native or primary language is not English must take the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) or another approved test.

A bachelor's degree in a relevant field, from an accredited institution. This must include coursework in general biology, general and organic chemistry, physics, and calculus.
A minimum undergraduate GPA of 3.0.
Transcripts from all undergraduate and graduate institutions attended.
Personal statement.
Three letters of recommendation.
Graduate Record Examination (GRE) general test scores are NOT required.
International applicants must also submit proof of English proficiency via TOEFL or IELTS scores.

Bachelor’s degree in the life sciences or chemistry from an accredited institution. Applicants must have completed at least one semester of calculus, one year of general chemistry with laboratory, one year of organic chemistry with laboratory, and one year of physics. It is highly desirable that applicants have completed at least one course in physical chemistry and one course in biochemistry.

Applicants for admission to the Ph.D. Program in Biochemistry and Molecular Biology must have a Bachelor's degree in biology, biochemistry, chemistry, or a related discipline from an accredited college or university. The following are required for admission: Three letters of recommendation. Transcripts from all undergraduate and graduate institutions attended. A statement of purpose. A curriculum vitae (CV)/resume. The Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) is required for applicants whose native language is not English. The application fee can be paid online with a credit card. The Graduate Record Examination (GRE) general test is no longer required for admission.

Undergraduate cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher.
Undergraduate major in Biochemistry, Biology, Chemistry, or Physics.

Applicants to this certificate must have an earned Master's degree from an accredited institution. Applicants must hold one of the following base certificates: Early Childhood (Birth-grade 2); Childhood (grades 1-6); English to Speakers of Other Languages; a middle childhood or adolescent certificate in a content area (e.g., English, mathematics, science, social studies); a special subject area (e.g., business, art, music); or a certificate in the area of students with disabilities that is linked to a specific grade level (e.g., students with disabilities, grades 1-6). Students must meet the general admissions requirements of the School of Professional Development. The application requires an official copy of your transcript(s), proof of New York State teacher certification, a Statement of Purpose, three letters of recommendation, and a résumé. To be admitted to this certificate program, students must be proficient in a language other than English. Students may demonstrate proficiency by one of the following means: Passing the Bilingual Education Assessment (BEA) in the target language (for New York State teacher certification); Taking an Oral Proficiency Interview (OPI) and a Writing Proficiency Test (WPT) and receiving a rating of Advanced-Low or higher; Having a bachelor's degree from an institution where the language of instruction was a language other than English.

Applicants must submit the following:

1. An application to the Graduate School.
2. Transcripts of all college/university courses.
3. A personal statement of purpose that outlines the student's background, research interests, career goals and suitability for the graduate program in Ecology and Evolution.
4. A curriculum vitae.
5. Three letters of recommendation.
6. GRE General Test scores (institution code 2548). The subject test in biology is not required but is recommended for applicants with a non-biology major. Note: The GRE is waived for applicants for fall 2024.
7. International applicants must take the TOEFL examination.

Students applying for admission must hold a bachelor's degree in a biological science or a related discipline with a G.P.A. of 3.0 or higher. Students are also expected to have completed coursework in organic chemistry, physics and calculus. Students may be admitted with deficiencies, but they will be required to make them up, without graduate credit, as early as possible.

Applicants are encouraged to write to faculty with whom they may wish to work.

A bachelor’s degree in Biology or a related discipline, with a major GPA of 3.0 or higher. The undergraduate degree must include at least 24 credits in biology and six credits in each of chemistry, physics and mathematics. Two letters of recommendation. A personal statement. Scores on the Graduate Record Examination (GRE) General Test.

Graduate Program in Biochemistry and Cell Biology Application Requirements:
• Online Application
• Application Fee
• Transcripts from all undergraduate and graduate institutions attended
• Three letters of recommendation
• A Statement of Purpose
• Resume or Curriculum Vitae
• GRE General test scores are NOT required.
• TOEFL/IELTS/Duolingo scores are required for applicants for whom English is not their first language.
• GPA of 3.0 or equivalent is required. Students with lower GPAs may be admitted under special circumstances.
The minimum acceptable TOEFL score is 85 for the MS program and 90 for the PhD program. The minimum acceptable IELTS score is 6.5 with no subsection below 6. The minimum acceptable Duolingo score is 115.

Qualified applicants will have a strong undergraduate background in the biological sciences, including coursework in biochemistry, molecular biology and genetics, as well as a strong background in chemistry, including organic and physical chemistry. Undergraduate research experience is very desirable.

Unofficial transcripts from all colleges and universities attended.
Three letters of recommendation.
Curriculum Vitae/Resume.
Personal Statement.
GRE General: Not Required.
International Applicants: See the International Academic Requirements page.

The complete application package must include the following: Completed online application form; Official transcripts from all colleges and universities attended; Three letters of recommendation; Personal Statement; Résumé/CV; Official GRE General Test scores (institution code: 2548). The GRE is waived for MS applicants for Spring and Fall 2024 admissions; Official TOEFL or IELTS scores (for students for whom English is not their native language); Application Fee.

A bachelor’s degree in biomedical engineering or a related engineering/science discipline, with a minimum cumulative grade point average of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. GRE is optional. The TOEFL/IELTS is required for all international students from a non-English speaking country. The application consists of: Stony Brook Graduate School online application, Application fee, Personal statement, Resume, Three letters of recommendation, Transcripts from all colleges and universities attended, TOEFL or IELTS scores (for international applicants).

Students applying to the Medical Physics track should have a Bachelor's degree in engineering, physics or a related discipline. Applicants are required to provide a complete set of transcripts for all undergraduate and graduate work, a personal statement and three letters of recommendation.
Program name: Biomedical Engineering MSBE with emphasis in Medical Physics

Requirements: A bachelor's degree in an engineering discipline is required. Applicants with degrees in the life sciences, physical sciences or mathematics are welcome to apply, but will need to complete a set of core undergraduate engineering courses before being granted matriculated status in the graduate program. A minimum overall graduate point average of 3.0 and a minimum grade point average of 3.0 in all engineering, mathematics, and science courses is required. In addition to the Graduate School's application requirements, the following are required: Three letters of recommendation, Personal statement, GRE General Test is not required and will not be considered if submitted., Curriculum Vitae/Resume is required. International applicants must also submit TOEFL or IELTS scores. Applicants are admitted to the Ph.D. program on a competitive basis.

All applicants to the graduate program in Biomedical Engineering must have a bachelor’s degree in engineering or the quantitative sciences (e.g., physics, chemistry, applied math, computer science, etc.). Students from other fields, such as biology, may be admitted but may be required to take a number of undergraduate engineering courses to make up for deficiencies in their background. A minimum GPA of 3.0 is required for admission.
Program name: Biomedical Engineering PhD with emphasis in Medical Physics

Requirements: A bachelor’s degree in a relevant discipline (such as computer science, biology, statistics, etc.), with a minimum overall grade point average of 3.0. At least one semester of object-oriented programming (OOP) in Python, Java, C++, or a related language. At least one semester of college-level biology (AP biology is acceptable). At least one semester of statistics. One letter of recommendation. Official transcripts from all colleges and universities attended. Personal statement.

All applicants must meet the Graduate School’s general admission requirements. Admission to the M.S. degree program in biomedical informatics requires the following:

A bachelor’s degree in engineering, computer science, physical sciences, life sciences, applied mathematics or statistics or a related field, from an accredited college or university.
A minimum undergraduate grade point average of 3.0
A minimum of two semesters of calculus, one semester of linear algebra, and one semester of probability and statistics.
Proficiency in computer programming in an object oriented language such as Java, C++, or Python, demonstrated either through coursework or work experience.

A Bachelor of Science or Bachelor of Arts from a fully accredited institution of higher learning in the quantitative sciences (e.g., Computer Science, Engineering, Applied Mathematics) or biological/health sciences (e.g., Biology, Biochemistry, Medicine). GPA of 3.0 or higher. GREs (both general and subject) are not required for admission to this program. Two semesters of calculus and one semester of linear algebra are required. Exceptions will be considered on an individual basis. Proficiency with at least one modern programming language is required. Exceptions will be considered on an individual basis. Two letters of recommendation from college faculty who can attest to the applicant’s academic potential and accomplishments. A personal statement which details the applicant’s interest in the BMI program and their past research experiences. A curriculum vitae (CV). For international applicants, a TOEFL or IELTS score is required. A minimum TOEFL score of 90 (internet-based test) or a minimum IELTS score of 6.5 is required for admission.

Admission to the Master of Science program in Biomedical Sciences is based on a comprehensive review of a number of factors, including academic transcripts from all colleges and universities attended, a personal statement, and letters of recommendation. The undergraduate grade point average (GPA) should be at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. The Graduate Record Examination (GRE) is not required. International students should also refer to the requirements outlined by the Graduate School.

Required Supporting Documents:
- Transcripts: from all previous colleges and universities attended are required.
- 3 Letters of Recommendation: Required.
- Resume or CV: Not Required.
- Personal Statement: Required. The Statement of Purpose should be approximately 1-2 pages in length, and should describe the applicant's prior research experience and future research interests.
- Writing Sample: Not Required.

Admission to the M.S. program requires a Bachelor's degree, with a minimum of 20 credits of college-level mathematics, including a two-semester sequence of calculus for science/engineering majors (equivalent to AMS 161 and 162 at Stony Brook), a course in linear algebra (equivalent to AMS 210), and a course in probability or statistics (equivalent to AMS 310 or 311). Applicants must have a grade point average of at least 3.0 in their undergraduate mathematics courses. Required application materials include: A Statement of Purpose, a resume or C.V., official transcripts from all undergraduate and graduate institutions attended, three letters of recommendation, and GRE General Test scores (verbal, quantitative, analytical writing).

In addition to the Graduate School's general admission requirements, applicants to the PhD in Population Health and Clinical Outcomes Research must have a bachelor's degree from an accredited university. A master's degree in a relevant field (e.g., MPH, MS) is preferred, but not required. No specific undergraduate major is required; however, applicants must demonstrate outstanding quantitative and analytic skills as evidenced through prior coursework (including at least one semester of calculus and at least one semester of statistics) and standardized test scores. Required documents include: an online application and fee, transcripts, three letters of recommendation, resume or curriculum vitae, personal statement, and official GRE scores (the GRE requirement is waived for applicants who have a doctoral-level degree from an accredited U.S. or Canadian institution). International students must also submit TOEFL or IELTS scores.

Application must include the following: An online application submitted to the Stony Brook University Graduate School. A statement of purpose. Three letters of recommendation. One official transcript from each college or university attended. A current resume or CV. Graduate Record Exam (GRE) is NOT required. TOEFL scores (for international applicants). A non-refundable application fee.

A complete application package includes:

An online application.
An application fee.
One official copy of all transcripts from any college or university attended. (A bachelor’s degree with a B average or its equivalent is required.)
Three letters of recommendation.
A statement of purpose.
A resume.
Test Scores - The GRE or GMAT is not required for Fall 2024 admissions.
International Applicants - TOEFL or IELTS is required. Minimum score requirements are listed on the Graduate School’s website here.

A bachelor’s degree in business, economics, engineering, mathematics, computer science or a hard science is required, with a minimum cumulative grade point average (GPA) of 3.0. Applicants must have taken at least two semesters of calculus and one semester of statistics with a grade of “B” or better. Work experience is not required, but related work or internship experience can strengthen an application.

Applicants for the Advanced Graduate Certificate in Business should possess an undergraduate degree from an accredited university. The GMAT will not be required for applicants to the Advanced Graduate Certificate in Business. The application consists of: An online application. An application fee. Transcripts from all colleges and universities attended. Two letters of recommendation. A resume or curriculum vitae. A personal statement.

At least 10 years of professional management or business experience, including at least 5 years in a senior leadership role.
An MBA, or a relevant business-focused master's degree, or its equivalent from an accredited U.S. university or its international equivalent.
A current resume or curriculum vitae.
Two letters of recommendation.
A 3-5 page statement of intent that addresses your professional experience, reasons for interest in the DBA, and how it will contribute to your professional goals. Please give us a preliminary indication of the area you intend to study in this essay.
Official transcripts from all universities and colleges attended.
Interview with the admissions committee (by invitation only).
International Applicants: must also demonstrate proof of English proficiency (see Stony Brook Graduate School requirements).
A non-refundable application fee.
The GMAT/GRE are not required for admission to the Executive DBA program.

The following are required in support of your application to the PhD Program in Business Administration:

- Official transcripts from all undergraduate and graduate schools attended.
- Official Graduate Record Examination (GRE) scores OR Graduate Management Admissions Test (GMAT) scores. Please request that ETS (for the GRE) or Pearson VUE (for the GMAT) send scores to Stony Brook University (institution code 2548). *GMAT or GRE scores are not required for PhD program admissions for Fall 2024. Applicants may voluntarily submit scores, and they will be reviewed by the admissions committee.
- Three letters of recommendation. Letters should be from faculty or other professionals who know you and your academic work.
- Resume or curriculum vitae.
- Statement of purpose. In a 1-2 page essay, describe your reasons for pursuing a PhD, your research interests, your career goals, and the reasons for your interest in Stony Brook's program.
- Official TOEFL or IELTS scores are required for most international applicants. Please see the Graduate School's requirements.
- A non-refundable application fee of $100.
- A writing sample is not required but may be submitted.

The following are in addition to the university's minimum requirements:

Three letters of recommendation
GMAT or GRE (The GMAT/GRE requirement has been waived for all Fall 2024 PhD applications.)
Statement of Purpose
Resume
Unofficial transcripts from all undergraduate and graduate institutions attended.
TOEFL/IELTS/Duolingo is required for students for whom English is not their first language.
Prerequisites: A bachelor's degree. A master's degree in a business or related field is preferable. While not a requirement, a research-oriented master's degree in a related discipline may increase the applicant's chances of admission.
Program name: Area of Emphasis in Accounting (Business PhD)

Requirements: The application deadline for fall admission is January 15. The GMAT/GRE test is a required component of the application. Strong quantitative skills and background are required for admission. The typical applicant has a strong quantitative background from one of the following fields: economics, engineering, applied mathematics, statistics, computer science, and business. We do not admit students for the Spring semester.
Program name: Area of Emphasis in Finance (Business PhD)

Requirements:
All applicants must submit a completed online application to the Graduate School, including:

Official transcripts from all undergraduate and graduate institutions attended.
Official Graduate Record Examination (GRE) or Graduate Management Admission Test (GMAT) scores. Please note: The GRE/GMAT requirement has been waived for all applicants applying to the program for Fall 2024 admissions.
Three letters of recommendation.
A personal statement.
An application fee.
A resume or curriculum vitae.
A writing sample. For example, a Master's thesis, a term paper or a publication.
Official TOEFL or IELTS scores. (for international students whose native language is not English).
Program name: Area of Emphasis in Management (Business PhD)

Requirements:
The following are required for an application to be considered complete and reviewed by the Admissions Committee:
- Online Application and Application Fee
- Transcripts from all previous colleges and universities attended
- Three Letters of Recommendation
- Statement of Purpose
- Resume/CV
- Official GMAT or GRE score report

In addition to the Graduate School's minimum requirements, the College of Business PhD program requires:
- A minimum undergraduate grade point average of 3.0 (on a 4.0 scale) and a minimum of 3.0 in all graduate work attempted.
- Official GMAT or GRE scores. The College of Business prefers the GMAT exam.
Program name: Area of Emphasis in Management Science (Business PhD)

Requirements: To be considered for admission, applicants must have a bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution. Applicants must also have a cumulative grade point average of 3.00 or higher. In addition to the online application, fee and transcripts, applicants must submit the following: A current resume; A personal statement that addresses the following question: How would you describe the unique characteristics of the business technology field and how will earning this MS degree position you for the career you want?; Three letters of recommendation; Official score report for the GRE or GMAT exam. The GRE/GMAT requirement may be waived if the applicant meets one of the following criteria: An undergraduate GPA of 3.2 or higher from an accredited institution. An earned master’s or doctoral degree from an accredited institution. 5+ years of relevant professional work experience.

GRE test: Not required
One official transcript of all previous college and university work.
A bachelor's degree in biophysics, chemistry, physics, engineering, biology or a related field.
A minimum undergraduate grade point average of 3.0.
Three letters of recommendation.
A personal statement describing research experience and career goals.
Non-native English speakers must take the TOEFL or IELTS exam and score above the required minimum.
Program name: Cellular Physiology and Molecular Biophysics PhD

Requirements: In addition to the Graduate School’s general admission requirements, applicants are expected to have a bachelor’s degree in chemical engineering or a closely related field from a college or university of recognized standing. Promise for graduate study is judged by the applicant’s undergraduate record, letters of recommendation and statement of purpose. All applicants are required to take the Graduate Record Examination (GRE) general test. International applicants who do not have a degree from an English-speaking university must also take the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL). Application materials must include: the completed application form, official transcripts of all college-level work, three letters of recommendation, statement of purpose and official GRE scores. International applicants whose native language is not English are also required to submit TOEFL scores.

In addition to the general admission requirements of the Graduate School, admission to the Ph.D. program in Chemical and Molecular Engineering requires a B.S. or M.S. degree in chemical engineering, materials science and engineering, or a related discipline from an accredited institution. Applicants are expected to have a minimum cumulative grade point average of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. The admission committee also holistically evaluates other credentials submitted by the applicant, including letters of recommendation, statement of purpose, and resume. The general GRE test is not required for admission.

A bachelor's degree in Chemistry or a related discipline with at least 24 credits in college chemistry and 12 credits in related areas, i.e., physics, biology and mathematics, with an average of B or better. Required application materials: Online Application, Application Fee, Transcripts, 3 Letters of Recommendation, Resume or C.V., Personal Statement, English Proficiency. GRE General: Not Required.

Applicants should have an undergraduate major in chemistry or a related discipline with a solid background in chemistry. At a minimum, students should have successfully completed one year of general chemistry, one year of organic chemistry, one year of physical chemistry, and one year of physics. Additional courses in analytical chemistry, inorganic chemistry, and mathematics are also recommended. A minimum overall GPA of 3.0 is required.

The following are required for an application to be complete:

- A completed application form for admission to the Graduate School
- A nonrefundable application fee
- Official transcripts from all universities and colleges attended
- Three letters of recommendation
- A personal statement
- GRE scores are not required for admission.
- Official TOEFL or IELTS scores for international applicants whose native language is not English.

For admission to the Ph.D. program in Chemistry, a bachelor’s degree in chemistry is required with courses in general, organic, and physical chemistry. The Graduate School requires a minimum undergraduate grade point average of 3.00 on a 4.00 scale. Applicants must submit a completed application form, letters of recommendation, and a personal statement. The general GRE test is not required. International students whose native language is not English must also submit scores from the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL).

Application Materials: A completed application form to the Graduate School. A non-refundable application fee. Two letters of recommendation from faculty under whom you have studied. One copy of official transcripts from each college or university you have attended. A brief statement of purpose (approximately 500 words) describing your reasons for seeking a certificate in Children’s Literature, your background in the subject, and your goals. A writing sample (approximately 10-20 pages) of your academic prose, preferably on a literary topic. A résumé that lists professional and educational experience. GRE scores are not required.

All application materials must be submitted through the Apply Yourself online application system. The complete set of required materials is: Graduate School Application and Fee, Transcripts, Three Letters of Recommendation, Statement of Purpose, GRE scores (required for MS and PhD applicants), Resume, TOEFL or IELTS scores (for international students).

Applicants must have a B.S. or M.S. degree in civil engineering or a related engineering field from an accredited college or university. A grade point average of at least 3.0/4.0 is normally required for admission. The Graduate Record Examination (GRE) general test is not required. Three letters of recommendation. A personal statement (statement of purpose).

An earned master's degree with a GPA of 3.0 or higher. Be a state-certified teacher, administrator or pupil personnel services provider (e.g., school counselor, psychologist, social worker). Submit an online application to the Graduate School. Submit a statement of purpose. Submit two letters of recommendation. Submit official transcripts from all colleges and universities attended. Submit a copy of your New York State teaching or service certificate.

To be admitted to the certificate program, a student must meet the graduate school admission requirements and must be enrolled in a Stony Brook PhD program in one of the following departments: Anthropology, Applied Mathematics and Statistics, Biomedical Engineering, Computer Science, Ecology and Evolution, Linguistics, Neurobiology and Behavior, Psychology, or Sociology. To be admitted to the program, a student must have a faculty advisor who is a member of the Cognitive Science faculty.

All applicants must have a bachelor's degree from a regionally accredited U.S. college or university, or a baccalaureate or its equivalent from a foreign institution of higher learning, and a minimum undergraduate grade point average of 3.00. Students applying to the MA in Computational Linguistics program are expected to have some previous coursework in linguistics (e.g., Introduction to Linguistics, Phonology, Syntax, Semantics) and in computer science (e.g., Introduction to Programming, Data Structures). However, students who have a strong record in one of these areas but not the other are still encouraged to apply.

A bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university. A minimum undergraduate grade point average of 3.0. Completion of at least 21 credits of liberal arts courses, including a course in statistics. A completed application for admission, including a personal statement, three letters of recommendation and official transcripts from all post-secondary schools attended. A minimum of 200 hours of documented work and/or volunteer experience in human services. For applicants with a GPA below 3.0, the School may consider an applicant for admission if they demonstrate outstanding performance in other areas of the application.
Program name: Concentration in Community and Political Social Action (MSW)

Requirements: A complete application includes: the online application form, a non-refundable application fee, unofficial transcripts from each college or university attended, three letters of recommendation submitted via the electronic recommendation system, a Personal Statement/Statement of Purpose, and English Proficiency Scores (e.g., TOEFL, IELTS) for applicants whose native language is not English. Note: Graduate Record Examination (GRE) general test scores are NOT required for applicants seeking admission for Fall 2024 and Spring 2025.
Program name: Concentration in Cosmetics and Consumer Goods (Product Design MS)

Requirements: Graduate School Application; Application Fee; Resume or C.V.; Personal Statement; Three Letters of Recommendation; Transcripts; GRE General: Not required for Fall 2024; TOEFL/IELTS: See Graduate School Requirements; Prerequisites: Bachelor's degree in engineering, the natural sciences, mathematics, computer science or management from an accredited institution. Applicants must have a minimum GPA of 3.0 overall in their undergraduate work.
Program name: Concentration in Educational Technology (Technological Systems Management MS)

Requirements:
The admission requirements below are the minimum requirements that must be met for an application to be considered. Meeting these requirements does not guarantee admission. All application materials are submitted online through the Graduate School's application system.

An undergraduate degree in materials science, engineering, chemistry, physics or a related discipline.
A minimum GPA of 3.0 out of 4.0.
GRE general test (Waived for all applications to MS and PhD programs submitted for Fall 2024.)
For international applicants, TOEFL or IELTS scores are required.
Three letters of recommendation.
A Statement of Purpose.
A complete online application form and payment of the application fee.
Transcripts from all undergraduate and graduate institutions attended.
A resume or CV.

To be admitted to the MS degree program, a student must hold a bachelor’s degree in chemical engineering or a related engineering or science field from a college or university of recognized standing. A minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale is required. Students from non-chemical engineering backgrounds may be required to take up to two undergraduate-level courses in addition to the normal graduate course requirements.
Program name: Concentration in Pharmaceutical and Biopharmaceutical (Product Design MS)

Requirements: Applicants must have a bachelor’s degree in engineering, science, management, or one of the social sciences. Students with other backgrounds may be admitted if their record shows evidence of the potential for success in a technology-based graduate program. All applicants must have at least one semester of college-level calculus with a grade of B or better. Applicants must have a minimum GPA of 3.0.
Program name: Concentration in Resilience and Sustainability (Technological Systems Management MS)

Requirements:
The School of Social Welfare seeks to admit individuals with a strong academic background who have demonstrated a commitment to the goals of social work through their paid and/or volunteer work experience. The following are the minimum requirements for admission to the MSW program:

- A bachelor’s degree from an accredited U.S. college or university, or the equivalent from a college or university in another country.
- A minimum grade point average of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale.
- The completion of at least 21 credits in the liberal arts and sciences, including coursework from at least three of the four following areas: humanities, social sciences, biological sciences, physical sciences, or mathematics.

In addition to meeting the above requirements, the following materials must be submitted as part of the online application to the Graduate School:

- An essay (personal statement) describing the basis of your interest in social work and your career goals.
- A résumé that highlights paid and volunteer work experience, as well as any published or presented scholarly work.
- Three letters of reference from former professors and/or employers or supervisors who can speak to your academic and professional abilities.
- Official transcripts of all prior college or university coursework.
Program name: Concentration in Social Work in Higher Education: Student-Community Development (MSW)

Requirements: Prerequisites: A bachelor's degree in engineering, natural sciences, or a quantitative social science with a minimum GPA of 3.0. Students with degrees in other fields who have substantial work experience may also be admitted. For international applicants, a TOEFL score of at least 85 is required for the MS program. Required Application Materials: Graduate School Application, Application fee, Resume or CV, Personal Statement, Transcripts, Three letters of recommendation, GRE General: Recommended, not required.
Program name: Concentration in Technology Management (Technological Systems Management MS)

Requirements: Admission to the Executive MBA in Health Management and Policy is highly competitive. Successful candidates will possess a bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution, at least 5 years of professional work experience, with a minimum of 2 years in a management or leadership role, and demonstrated leadership potential and a commitment to a career in healthcare. Application requirements include: Application and Fee; Official transcripts from all colleges and universities attended; A current resume detailing your professional experience, education, and skills; Two letters of recommendation from professional or academic references; A personal statement (500-750 words) that addresses your career goals, why you are interested in the Executive MBA in Health Management and Policy, and what you will contribute to the program. GMAT or GRE scores are not required for applicants with 7+ years of significant managerial experience. For all other applicants, scores are optional but may strengthen your application. Waivers may be considered on a case-by-case basis. An interview with the admissions committee may be required.
Program name: Executive MBA in Health Management and Policy

Requirements: Applications must include the following: The Graduate School application. A Personal Statement describing your motivation for pursuing a PhD in Biochemistry and Molecular Biology at Stony Brook, your previous research experience, and your future research interests. Three letters of recommendation from faculty who know you and your academic and research abilities. A curriculum vitae (CV). Transcripts from all undergraduate and graduate institutions attended. The General GRE is NOT required for admission to our graduate program. The TOEFL exam is required for international students from countries in which English is not the official language.
Program name: Executive PhD in Biochemistry and Molecular Biology Online

Requirements:
To be considered for admission, applicants must have:
- A master's degree in any subject from an accredited institution.
- An undergraduate grade point average of 3.00 or higher.
- A graduate grade point average of 3.00 or higher.
- Access to the Internet and an active email account.
In addition, applicants must submit:
- A State University of New York (SUNY) application.
- A non-refundable application fee.
- A personal statement that details the reasons for pursuing this certificate.
- Official transcripts from all colleges and universities attended.
- Two letters of recommendation.

In addition to the School of Professional Development's admission requirements, applicants to this program must have:

- A bachelor's degree.
- A minimum cumulative grade point average of 3.00.
- Two letters of recommendation.
- A current résumé.
- A personal statement.

Bachelor's degree; Minimum cumulative grade point average of 3.0; An official transcript from each college or university attended; Two letters of recommendation; A personal statement; A current résumé; A non-refundable $100 application fee. Note: GREs are not required.

A bachelor's degree with a minimum cumulative grade point average of 3.0 from an accredited institution. Applicants who do not meet this requirement may be admitted on a conditional basis. Please see the policy on conditional admission in the SPD Bulletin.
A completed application for graduate studies.
Two letters of recommendation.
A current résumé.
A statement of purpose.
Official transcripts from all colleges and universities attended.
GRE is not required.

To be admitted to the Master of Arts in Liberal Studies, students must have:

A bachelor's degree with a B average (3.0 on a 4.0 scale), or its equivalent from an accredited college or university.
One official copy of all transcripts from each college or university attended. Unofficial transcripts are accepted for initial review of your application.
A personal statement that addresses the following: (1) what you hope to achieve by pursuing graduate study in liberal studies and (2) how your academic and/or professional background has prepared you for this program.
Two letters of recommendation.
A non-refundable $100 application fee, paid online via credit card.
A current resume.
A writing sample, such as a paper submitted for an undergraduate course.
Graduate Record Examination (GRE) scores are not required.

Online application
Application fee
Transcripts from all colleges and universities attended
Minimum undergraduate GPA of 3.0

Personal statement
Resume or CV
GRE General Test is not required.
TOEFL or IELTS is required for applicants whose native language is not English.

The following application materials are required: the Graduate School Online Application and application fee; a Personal Statement (a concise one- to two-page statement explaining your academic purpose for graduate study and why you wish to pursue this at Stony Brook’s School of Marine and Atmospheric Sciences); a Resume or Curriculum Vitae; three letters of recommendation; official transcripts from all colleges and universities attended; and official TOEFL or IELTS scores for international students. Note: SoMAS has dropped the GRE requirement for applications for the 2024 admissions cycle.

Formal application to the Marine Biology and Ecology track of the Marine and Atmospheric Science Ph.D. program is made through the Graduate School. Applicants should indicate the Marine Biology and Ecology Track on the application form. All applicants must meet the following minimum requirements for admission to the Marine Biology and Ecology program: 1. Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university in one of the natural sciences (e.g. biology, ecology, chemistry, physics, geology) or engineering. 2. One year of biology with lab, one year of inorganic chemistry with lab, and one semester each of organic chemistry, physics and calculus. Recommended courses include statistics, physical chemistry and additional math courses. 3. A minimum undergraduate GPA of 3.0/4.0. 4. A minimum GPA of 3.0 in all science and math courses. 5. Submission of the GRE General Test is no longer required and scores will not be considered during the application review. 6. Three letters of recommendation. 7. A Statement of Purpose outlining the applicant’s research interests and career goals and how they relate to SoMAS faculty. 8. For international students whose native language is not English, a minimum TOEFL iBT score of 90.

The following materials are required to be submitted with the online Graduate School application: A 1-2 page statement detailing your interest in the program and career goals; Transcripts from all undergraduate and graduate institutions attended; Three letters of recommendation from academic or professional references; Resume/CV.

Admission to the MES-MPS degree is based on a holistic review of each applicant’s file. Competitive applicants will typically have completed an undergraduate degree in the natural sciences, social sciences or humanities with an overall GPA of 3.0 or better and have some work or volunteer experience in a related field. Students seeking admission must fulfill all admission requirements of the Graduate School. Completed applications must be submitted by the deadlines provided by the Graduate School and consist of the following:

An online application to the Graduate School
Official transcripts of all college/university coursework
A personal statement
Three letters of recommendation
A resume or CV
The GRE is not required for admission to this program.

The Graduate School requires a minimum undergraduate GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. The following application materials must be submitted online: Online application and application fee; Transcripts from each university or college attended. Unofficial transcripts are accepted at the time of application. Official transcripts will be required if an offer of admission is accepted; Three letters of recommendation; A statement of purpose; A resume/CV; The Department of Geosciences no longer requires the GRE general test for admission to the graduate program.

Application Fee
Personal Statement

Transcripts from all colleges and universities attended
GRE test scores (optional for domestic applicants)
